page.title: 10LOXLEY COMMON / GAMES
page.content: {Loxley Common}is a very extensive area consisting of marsh,open moorland and woodland. The marsh has trees growing in it; mainly silver birch and small oaks.There was a gibbet on the open moorland in earlier times. Because the Common is so near to the village it is well used and the school uses it for environmental studies. {Playground and Street Games} The main games played by the children of Loxley are Bulldog, Football, Rounders, Skipping, Leap Frog, Hopscotch, various tiggy games, Hide and Seek and Conkers. There are rhymes to go with the skipping such as "Tinker, tailor," and "Salt, vinegar, mustard, pepper."
